page.title: 02Swindon Village
page.content: Once Swindon was a small village.It didn't even have a church until 1854. During the last 131 years a school has built as well as shops and many more houses. The village has expanded tremendously particularly during the past few years when the houses in Baldwin Way and Reynolds Close were built.In Swindon there is a fish shop, off licence,post office and newsagents. In the last few years we have had a cricket field and club house.Each year the village holds a summer fete.The money from this is shared between St.John's Church and Himley church. There used to be a police station but now we come under Kinver police.St. John's church was built in 1854.The records show that the first wedding held in the church was on 25th December 1854.
